events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on a busy downtown street, damaging the front bumper and headlight.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to reported damage to the car from the collision.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim and contact them for further investigation.
The customer received an acknowledgment of the claim submission along with initial guidance on the required next steps.
The agent requested photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with the claim assessment.
The customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photographs of the damage and official police report.
Investigation of the accident circumstances has commenced to verify details and assess claim validity and liability.
Investigation concluded confirming the collision was accidental and coverage applies for the vehicle repair claim.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer to cover the repair costs of the car’s front bumper and related damages.
Customer acknowledged the settlement offer positively and requested clarification on the payment timeline.
The claim was officially approved following customer acceptance of the settlement proposal with all conditions met.
Payment for the approved settlement was processed and issued to the customer’s bank account for vehicle repair.
The claim file was closed after confirmation that payment was received and repairs were scheduled by the customer.
Final administrative step completed with the archival of the closed auto accident claim record in the system.
